2 (1) There shall be established a foundation which shall (Establisheneat of
be called the Sigiriya Heritage Foundation (hereinafter Sistiys Hertaye
referred to as the Foundaton), Foundation.
(2) The Foundation shall by the name assigned to it by
subsection (1), be a body corporate with perpetual succession
and a. common seal and may sue and be sued in such name.
3k The objects of the Foundation shall be Objects of te
Foundation.
(@) to promote the preservation, conservation, and
development, of the cultural, archaeological and
natural heritage of the Sigiriya World Heritage Site
and its eaviroas ; :
) to promote interest among the peaple of Sri Lanka
and abroed, in Sigiriya and to educate the people on
the conservation and preservation ofthe Sigiriya World
Heritage Site and it's environs ;
() taprovide access to, and facilities for, the appreciation
of, the Sigiriya World Heritage Site and its environs ;
2 Sigiriya Heritage Foundation Act No. 62 of 1998
{@) to promote the general welfare of the people residing
i the environs of the Sigiriya World Heritage Site,
oy the development of, education, accommodation,
and medical facilities ;
{) to co-ordinate and collaborate with international
professional organisations such as UNESCO,
ICCORM, ICOMOS, ICOM AND IUCN ;
{f) to organise and facilitate the holding of study courses,
workshops and seminars to educate people about the
Sigiriya World Heritage Site and its environs ;
@) to establish and maintain, educational institutions,
Museums, research centres, libraries and places
providing information services, to facilitate the study
of the cultural, archaeological and natural heritage of
. the Sigitiya World Heritage Site and its environs ;
(A) to undertake and to fund, research on various facets
of the Sigiriya World Heritage Site and to publish the
Tesults of such research ;
{to publish journals, books, pamphlets, and newsletters,
with a view to promoting the objects of the
Foundation ; and
@ to do such other acts or things as may be necessary
for the attainment of all or any of the above abjects of
the Foundation. .
Powers of the 4. (1) The Foundation shall subject to the provisions of

Central Culrual Fund means the Central Cultural Fund

+ established by the Ceylon Tourist Board Act, No. 10
ICCROM means the International Centre for the study
of Preservation and Restoration of Cultural Property,
Rome;

ICOMOS"means the International Council on

ICOM means the International Council of Museums ;
Tostirational Membec means a person or institution who

the Fund of the Foundation ;
IUCN means the International Union for the
Conservation of Nature ;
local authority means any Municipat Council, Urban

authority created or established by or under any law
to exercise, perforin and discharge, powers, duties
and functions corresponding or similar to, the
powers, duties and functions exercised, performed

established by Chapter XVILA of the Constitution ;
Sigiriya World Heritage Site means the area declared to
be an archaeological reserve by Notification made
. tunder section 33 of the Antiquities Ordinance and
published in Gazette No, 10,370 of March 21, 1952
and the area dectared as a development area by Order
made under section 3 of Urban Development
Authority Act, No. 41 of 1978 and published in
Gazene No. 542/10 of January 27,1998;

Scientific and Cultural Organisation;
Urban Development Authority means the Urban
Development Authority established by the Urban
Development Authority Law, No. 41 Of 1978.
